column3: Charge Description
Knowingly and willfully causing the death of another with premeditation, or aiding and abetting in such a murder. (Flatbacking applicable)
Criminal association or aiding in a murder plot or execution.

column2: Murder of a Public Servant or Peace Officer
column3: Intentional killing of a government official during lawful duties.

column2: Attempted Murder of a Public Servant
column3: Attempt to kill a public servant with clear intent, act incomplete.

column2: Association: Attempted Murder of a Public Servant
column3: Accomplice in an attempted murder of a public servant.
Coerced exploitation of individuals for labor or sexual acts.
Acts or threats of violence meant to intimidate or influence government or civilians.
Engagement in or benefiting from an organized pattern of felony crimes.
Criminally associated with an enterprise engaged in racketeering.
Theft or hijacking of an aircraft or cargo through force or threat.
Armed or violent robbery of a financial institution.
Acting in concert with others to plan or execute a major robbery.
Disruption or disrespect interfering with court operations.
Defying a specific, active court order or ruling.
Repeated violations or threats against the judiciary.
Tampering with evidence, interfering with investigations or proceedings.
Falsely acting as a judicial officer to issue rulings or orders.
Pretending to be a public official for influence or access.
Misusing public office for personal gain or engaging in misconduct.
Unwanted verbal or physical conduct of a sexual nature.
Non-consensual sexual contact including touching or coercion.
Unauthorized possession or destruction of government-owned property.
Forcing another to act unlawfully or against their will using threats.
Inciting or organizing unlawful attempts to undermine lawful governance.
Knowingly providing false or misleading information to law enforcement or emergency services.
Participating in or encouraging false reporting to authorities.
Willfully interfering with a public official’s lawful performance of duties.

column2: Association: Obstruction of a Public Official
column3: Acting in concert to obstruct a public official’s duties.
Intentionally encouraging or participating in acts that provoke public disorder or violence.
Collaborating or conspiring to incite or sustain riotous behavior.
Deliberately interfering with evidence, machinery, or judicial processes to deceive or hinder justice.
Acting together to tamper with evidence or obstruct legal procedures.
Taking law enforcement into one’s own hands without authorization, acting as an extrajudicial enforcer.
Participating with others in unauthorized law enforcement or violent self-justice.
Repeated unwanted conduct or communication causing fear or distress.
Collaborating in stalking or harassment campaigns against a victim.
Assisting, facilitating, or encouraging the commission of a criminal offense.
Acting with others to aid or abet criminal conduct.
Possessing identification documents unlawfully with intent to defraud or evade law enforcement.
Participating in possession or use of stolen IDs for criminal purposes.
Intentional act causing bodily injury or apprehension of harm to another person.
Coordinated participation in assaultive behavior.
Unlawful restraint, confinement, or transport of an individual against their will.
Collaborating or conspiring to commit kidnapping.

column2: Trespassing with Intent to Commit a Crime
column3: Unauthorized entry on property with the purpose to commit an unlawful act.

column2: Association: Trespassing with Intent to Commit a Crime
column3: Jointly planning or executing trespassing to commit crimes.
Falsely representing oneself as another to deceive or defraud.
Collaborative impersonation or aiding in deceptive identity misrepresentation.
Intentional deception to obtain unlawful financial or personal gain.
Coordinated efforts to perpetrate fraudulent schemes.
Assault involving use of a deadly weapon or causing serious bodily harm.
Acting together to carry out assault with a deadly weapon or serious injury.
Agreement between two or more persons to commit a criminal offense.
Participation in planning or facilitating conspiratorial criminal acts.
Falsely presenting oneself as law enforcement to gain advantage or intimidate.
Assisting or collaborating in false police impersonation.
Concealing the origins of illegally obtained funds through transfers or shell companies.
Participation in laundering proceeds of crime with others.
Unauthorized entry or presence on government-controlled land or facilities.
Acting jointly to unlawfully enter or remain on government premises.
Causing death through reckless or negligent conduct without intent.
Assisting or facilitating reckless conduct resulting in death.
Causing death through negligent or reckless operation of a vehicle.
Acting with others in conduct leading to death by vehicle.
Assisting or facilitating a second-degree murder, before or after the fact.

column2: Association: Accessory to Second Degree Murder
column3: Participation in aiding or abetting second-degree murder.
Organized robbery targeting warehouses with high-value goods.
Acting jointly in the planning or execution of a warehouse robbery.
Using force or threat to steal from commercial establishments.
Conspiring or participating in store robbery with others.
Repeated behavior intended to alarm, annoy, torment, or terrorize another individual.
Coordinated efforts to harass or intimidate a victim.
Deliberate attempt to kill without premeditation where victim survives.
Participating in attempt to kill without premeditation.
Holding or concealing property known to be stolen.
Acting jointly in possession or concealment of stolen property.
Operating or possessing a vehicle known to be stolen.

column2: Association: Possession of a Stolen Vehicle
column3: Participating in possession or use of stolen vehicles.
Attempting to deceive for financial or personal gain.
Collaborating in attempts to defraud others.
Retaining lost property without reasonable effort to return it.
Acting together in misappropriation or concealment of lost property.
Forcing someone to act against their will through threats or coercion.
Acting jointly to coerce or threaten for unlawful gain.
Unlawful taking of a motor vehicle with intent to permanently deprive owner.
Collaborating in motor vehicle theft or possession.
Attempting to coerce or threaten another for gain.
Participating in attempts to extort or threaten others.
Threatening serious bodily harm to instill fear.
Acting in concert to issue criminal threats.

column2: Felon in Possession of a Firearm
column3: Convicted felon unlawfully found in possession of a firearm.

column2: Association: Felon in Possession of a Firearm
column3: Assisting or enabling possession of firearms by felons.
Unlawful departure from lawful detention or arrest.
Collaborating to aid escape or evade custody.
Physically attacking or threatening a law enforcement officer.

column2: Association: Assault on a Peace Officer
column3: Participating in attacks or threats against peace officers.
Possession of highly dangerous, illegal drugs such as heroin or LSD.
Assisting or conspiring to possess Schedule I controlled substances.
Possession of high potential abuse drugs such as cocaine or methamphetamine.
Participation in possession or distribution of Schedule II substances.
Possession of moderate-risk controlled substances.
Collaboration in possession or trafficking of Schedule III substances.
Possession of lower-risk substances such as Xanax.
Participation in possession or trafficking of Schedule IV substances.
Careless firing of a weapon endangering others.

column2: Association: Negligent Discharge of a Firearm
column3: Acting with others in negligent firearm discharge.
Discharging a firearm as part of gang activity.
Participating in gang-related firearm offenses.
Intentional infliction of harm or neglect on an animal without justification.
Collaborative cruelty or neglect of animals.
Non-violent refusal to obey lawful police orders.
Joint refusal or obstruction of law enforcement without violence.
Physical resistance or assault against law enforcement during arrest or detention.
Acting in concert to resist arrest or law enforcement violently.
Forcible robbery of a residence targeting valuable property.
Participation in planning or committing house robbery.
Knowingly ignoring lawful police commands such as fleeing or resisting arrest dangerously.
Collaborating in evasion or resistance of lawful orders.
Intentional or reckless destruction of property exceeding a value threshold (usually $5,000).
Joint involvement in property destruction offenses.

The willful and malicious act of setting fire to or causing the burning of any property, vehicle, structure, or land. This includes actions intended to damage, destroy, or endanger life or property through the use of fire or incendiary devices. Arson may be committed for purposes such as insurance fraud, retaliation, intimidation, or vandalism, and includes both successful and attempted acts.
The deliberate and unlawful attempt to kill another civilian without legal justification, where the attempt fails but the intent to cause death is evident.

column2: Association with Attempted Murder of a Civilian
column3: Knowingly aiding, abetting, conspiring, or being an accessory to an attempted murder, without directly committing the act.
An intentional killing carried out without premeditation, often occurring impulsively but with an awareness the act could result in death.
Knowingly participating in or facilitating a second-degree murder without directly executing the act, including prior assistance or post-offense concealment.

column2: Accessory to the Murder of a Public Servant
column3: Aiding, abetting, or facilitating the murder of a public servant without directly committing the act, with intent to assist.
A planned, forceful robbery of a Fleeca Bank branch, often involving weapons or intimidation to steal money or valuables.
Knowingly participating in or facilitating a Fleeca Bank Heist without directly executing the robbery (e.g., planning, transport, lookout).
The unlawful taking of property or funds from a person or entity using or threatening a weapon to intimidate or coerce.
Assisting in the planning, execution, or concealment of an armed robbery, including roles such as driver, lookout, or supplier.
The intentional or reckless act of causing minor physical harm or offensive contact to another person without a deadly weapon, such as pushing, slapping, or light punches.
The deliberate infliction or attempted infliction of moderate physical harm, which may involve repeated blows, blunt objects, or actions resulting in notable pain or distress.
Willfully fleeing or attempting to elude law enforcement during a lawful stop or pursuit, whether on foot or in a vehicle.
Refusing to comply with a lawful order or command issued by a peace officer in the line of duty, excluding acts of fleeing or resisting arrest.
Repeated, unwanted behavior or communication directed at another person with the intent to intimidate, annoy, or provoke emotional distress.
Engaging in, offering, or soliciting sexual acts in exchange for money, services, or goods; applies to both buyers and sellers.
Disruptive behavior in public that disturbs peace or provokes alarm, including public intoxication, aggressive arguments, or offensive gestures.
Refusing or failing to present lawful identification when required by law enforcement during an official stop, detention, or lawful arrest.
Actively opposing or interfering with a lawful arrest through physical struggle, obstruction, or verbal refusal, excluding fleeing or violence.
Engaging in loud, aggressive, or disruptive behavior in a public space, such as fighting, yelling, or causing undue alarm to the public.
Entering or remaining unlawfully on private or restricted property, including fenced areas or posted zones, without authorization.
Urinating in a public area within view of others, violating public decency and sanitation laws.
Defecating in a public area in view of others, constituting a public nuisance and health hazard.
Taking substantial steps toward unlawfully stealing a vehicle with intent to permanently deprive the owner, though the theft was not completed.
Intentional defacement, damage, or destruction of property—public or private—including graffiti and tagging, not exceeding a felony threshold.
Possessing a firearm without the proper licensing, registration, or legal authorization.
Displaying a firearm in a threatening, careless, or intimidating manner without justification.
Possessing or modifying a firearm with attachments that are banned, such as suppressors, extended mags, or illegal scopes.
Firing a weapon in public or unauthorized areas without lawful cause, not aimed to harm but still dangerous.

column2: Possession of Government-Issued Equipment or Weapons
column3: Unauthorized possession of weapons, gear, or tools that are exclusive to law enforcement, military, or government agencies.
Possession of a restricted mid-grade weapon (e.g., SMGs or tactical rifles) without the appropriate license or role.
Possession of high-grade military or automatic weapons with no authorization — includes LMGs, RPGs, or explosives.
Possessing a small personal-use quantity of marijuana without proper licensing or in a restricted area.
Growing marijuana plants without a permit, limited in scale (personal use or small operation).
Large-scale or commercial marijuana grow operation without authorization, often exceeding legal plant limits.

column2: Possession of Marijuana with Intent to Distribute
column3: Holding quantities of marijuana clearly packaged or prepared for distribution or sale to others.
Possessing illegal drugs such as cocaine, heroin, meth, or prescription narcotics without a prescription.

column2: Possession of a Controlled Substance with Intent to Distribute
column3: Possessing large quantities of illegal drugs or paraphernalia clearly intended for sale or trafficking.
Transporting, distributing, or importing illegal narcotics on a regional or national level — high-scale operation.
The suspect was found in possession of processed cocaine, with no regard to intent. (5 or more bags)
The suspect was found in possession of a substantial quantity of processed cocaine. (50 or more bags)
The suspect was found in possession of cocaine in a quantity indicative of distribution, during a known drug sale incident. (10 or more bags)

column2: Possession with Intent to Distribute (Large Quantity)
column3: The suspect was found with a significant quantity of cocaine during a drug sale incident, clearly intended for distribution. (50 or more bags)
The suspect was actively producing cocaine in known manufacturing zones, such as Cuba, Madagascar, or Horseshoe Island.
The suspect was found in possession of materials commonly used in the production of cocaine, in a context indicating potential manufacturing activity.
The suspect was involved in the transportation or smuggling of large quantities of cocaine, typically via maritime or aerial routes. (100 or more bags)
Remaining on or near government buildings, facilities, or restricted zones without a lawful purpose or after being asked to leave.
Crossing a street outside of a designated crosswalk or against a traffic signal, creating a public safety concern.
